ai.summary: A challenging 64.2 km segment of the Cape Wrath Trail from Bendronaig to Kinlochewe in the UK. This remote, multi-day trek traverses rugged coastal and Highland terrain, demanding solid navigation, fitness, and weather preparedness.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged NW Scotland terrain with a mix of coastal paths, moorland, peat bogs, and rocky ridges. Expect long remote sections, few resupply points, river/stream crossings, and exposure to wind and changing weather.
ai.safety_notes: Remote, long-distance hike with limited rescue options. Prepare for rapid weather changes and challenging navigation. Carry map and compass (GPS optional), know your route, and have a detailed itinerary. Ensure adequate clothing, water supply, and water purification. Plan for water and food; be mindful of tidal or coastal conditions and river crossings. Carry a first aid kit, whistle, headlamp, and emergency signaling device (PLB or satellite messenger if possible). Inform someone of your itinerary and check-in plans. In the UK, know how to contact emergency services at 999/112.
recommended_gear: Stove or cooking system and fuel
First aid kit with blister care
Personal locator beacon (PLB) or satellite messenger (optional)
ai.best_seasons: May to September offers longer daylight and typically drier weather; outside this window, conditions can be severe and daylight limited.

seo.title: Cape Wrath Trail – Bendronaig to Kinlochewe (64.2 km, Hard) UK
seo.meta_description: Guide to the Cape Wrath Trail segment Bendronaig → Kinlochewe. A 64.2 km hard hike through remote NW Scotland with terrain, safety tips, gear lists, and best seasons.
